com.afollestad.materialdialogs

Class MaterialDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Dialog
      • com.afollestad.materialdialogs.MaterialDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface, android.content.DialogInterface.OnShowListener, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class MaterialDialog
extends android.app.Dialog
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MaterialDialog.Builder
      The class used to construct a MaterialDialog.
      static class  MaterialDialog.ButtonCallback
      Deprecated. 
      Use the individual onPositive, onNegative, onNeutral, or onAny Builder methods instead.
      static interface  MaterialDialog.InputCallback 
      static interface  MaterialDialog.ListCallback
      A callback used for regular list dialogs.
      static interface  MaterialDialog.ListCallbackMultiChoice
      A callback used for multi choice (check box) list dialogs.
      static interface  MaterialDialog.ListCallbackSingleChoice
      A callback used for multi choice (check box) list dialogs.
      static interface  MaterialDialog.ListLongCallback
      A callback used for regular list dialogs.
      static interface  MaterialDialog.SingleButtonCallback
      An alternate way to define a single callback.

      • show

        Overrides:
        show in class android.app.Dialog

      • getActionButton

        public final MDButton getActionButton(DialogAction which)
        Retrieves the view of an action button, allowing you to modify properties such as whether or not it's enabled. Use setActionButton(DialogAction, int) to change text, since the view returned here is not the view that displays text.
        Parameters:
        which - The action button of which to get the view for.
        Returns:
        The view from the dialog's layout representing this action button.

      • getView

        public final android.view.View getView()
        Retrieves the view representing the dialog as a whole. Be careful with this.

      • getInputEditText

        public final android.widget.EditText getInputEditText()

      • getTitleView

        public final android.widget.TextView getTitleView()
        Retrieves the TextView that contains the dialog title. If you want to update the title, use #setTitle(CharSequence) instead.

      • getIconView

        public android.widget.ImageView getIconView()
        Retrieves the ImageView that contains the dialog icon.

      • getContentView

        public final android.widget.TextView getContentView()
        Retrieves the TextView that contains the dialog content. If you want to update the content (message), use #setContent(CharSequence) instead.

      • getCustomView

        public final android.view.View getCustomView()
        Retrieves the custom view that was inflated or set to the MaterialDialog during building.
        Returns:
        The custom view that was passed into the Builder.

      • setActionButton

        public final void setActionButton(DialogAction which,
                                  CharSequence title)
        Updates an action button's title, causing invalidation to check if the action buttons should be stacked. Setting an action button's text to null is a shortcut for hiding it, too.
        Parameters:
        which - The action button to update.
        title - The new title of the action button.

      • setActionButton

        public final void setActionButton(DialogAction which,
                                  int titleRes)
        Updates an action button's title, causing invalidation to check if the action buttons should be stacked.
        Parameters:
        which - The action button to update.
        titleRes - The string resource of the new title of the action button.

      • hasActionButtons

        public final boolean hasActionButtons()
        Gets whether or not the positive, neutral, or negative action button is visible.
        Returns:
        Whether or not 1 or more action buttons is visible.

      • numberOfActionButtons

        public final int numberOfActionButtons()
        Gets the number of visible action buttons.
        Returns:
        0 through 3, depending on how many should be or are visible.

      • setProgressPercentFormat

        public final void setProgressPercentFormat(NumberFormat format)
        Change the format of the small text showing the percentage of progress. The default is NumberFormat.getPercentageInstance().

      • setProgressNumberFormat

        public final void setProgressNumberFormat(String format)
        Change the format of the small text showing current and maximum units of progress. The default is "%1d/%2d".

      • isCancelled

        public final boolean isCancelled()

      • getSelectedIndex

        public int getSelectedIndex()
        Convenience method for getting the currently selected index of a single choice list.
        Returns:
        Currently selected index of a single choice list, or -1 if not showing a single choice list

      • getSelectedIndices

        public Integer[] getSelectedIndices()
        Convenience method for getting the currently selected indices of a multi choice list
        Returns:
        Currently selected index of a multi choice list, or null if not showing a multi choice list

      • setSelectedIndex

        public void setSelectedIndex(int index)
        Convenience method for setting the currently selected index of a single choice list. This only works if you are not using a custom adapter; if you're using a custom adapter, an IllegalStateException is thrown. Note that this does not call the respective single choice callback.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the list item to check.

      • setSelectedIndices

        public void setSelectedIndices(Integer[] indices)
        Convenience method for setting the currently selected indices of a multi choice list. This only works if you are not using a custom adapter; if you're using a custom adapter, an IllegalStateException is thrown. Note that this does not call the respective multi choice callback.
        Parameters:
        indices - The indices of the list items to check.

      • clearSelectedIndices

        public void clearSelectedIndices()
        Clears all selected checkboxes from multi choice list dialogs.

      • clearSelectedIndices

        public void clearSelectedIndices(boolean sendCallback)
        Clears all selected checkboxes from multi choice list dialogs.
        Parameters:
        sendCallback - Defaults to true. True will notify the multi-choice callback, if any.

      • selectAllIndices

        public void selectAllIndices()
        Selects all checkboxes in multi choice list dialogs.

      • selectAllIndices

        public void selectAllIndices(boolean sendCallback)
        Selects all checkboxes in multi choice list dialogs.
        Parameters:
        sendCallback - Defaults to true. True will notify the multi-choice callback, if any.
